channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flooded road, 3rd September
item.description:
This was supposed to have been sorted in March but the road is flooded again, the drains are blocked and need to be cleared. After that the real problem needs to be sorted as brought up before ref 11476403
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 54, Cheltenham Road, Winchcombe, Winchcombe

item.description:
A real hazard for anyone particularly those with restricted eyesight or mobility

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Pilley Lane, Leckhampton, Cheltenham

item.title: Drain blocked, 3rd September
item.description:
The drain immediately outside No. 1 Whitecross Square is almost completely blocked. I managed to free up two others using my umbrella, but the drain is obstructed too far down for this to be effective. Previous blockage of this drain caused major damage to the property.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, White Cross Square, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding caused by blocked drains, 3rd September
item.description:
We live in number 12. Our driveway is the lowest point and we are consistently getting flooded and it comes into the house. We have to manually remove water . Fortunately we were home but if not this would be a disaster. This happens when we have a sudden heavy downpour.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Church Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Life-threatening traffic incidents, 3rd September
item.description:
There are roadworks on the A40 and a road closure causing absolute carnage in Charlton Kings village, specifically East End Road. There are HGVs mounting kerbs, huge volumes of traffic blocked up in both directions, and kids dodging angry frustrated drivers. It is a matter of time until there is a terrible accident, especially with the schools returning tomorrow. There urgently needs to be signage around the works and at the start of the diversion, for example parking restrictions should have been put in place along both East End Road/Church Street/New Street/Horsefair Street, however frustrating and inconvenient that might be for residents who don't have off road parking, a 7.5t weight limit in place (and enforced!) at the junction of the A40/East End Road, and no entry from the A40 into Herne Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42, Church Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Bin overflowing, 3rd September
item.description:
In playground at Burrows Field. Please could it be emptied.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Peregrine Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Previous Work Causing Flooding, 3rd September
item.description:
Hello, the previous job completed by the council at my address - GL53 9NN - has caused the flow of water going down the hill during heavy periods of rain to be diverted into my house. Instead of continuing down the natural drainage ‘V’ channel, the workers placed tarmac which caused the water to divert onto my drive and therefore towards my property. This came to light today and very nearly caused my house to flood. I would appreciate if the council came to fix this matter urgently.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cowley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Increased use of access only road due to London rd closure, 3rd September
item.description:
Lots of cars are now using School Road (which is access only) as a cut through due to London Road being closed for the bridge repairs. Given this road only had two passing points it’s causing traffic issues for residents (we are having lots of cars turning into our drive) and also pedestrians as cars are speeding down the road and the pavements are minimal or have cars parked on them. It’s dangerous especially with Balcarras back at school as it’s one of the main pedestrian routes. A sign at each end needs to be placed reminding cars it’s access only and not a suitable diversion.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 55, School Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Water flowing under gate into our property after heavy rain, 3rd September
item.description:
Junction of Blacksmiths Lane, Deep Street and Bouncers Lane. Water appears to flow down Blacksmiths Lane after heavy rain, then accumulate at the junction to a depth of several inches. Some of this water flows under our gate and into our back garden (the wooden gate visible in the photograph). We are fearful that if this continues there may be a risk of the house flooding too.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Deep Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping, 3rd September
item.description:
There are a number of items of furniture that have been abandoned in Cypress Garden and Evergreen walk. Outside no19 on the foot path there is a table and a storage unit left on public footpath. Behind 8 Evergreen walk in the hedgerows along the back of parking area there are two chairs an old food waste bin and a children’s basketball hoop, and just on the path there is a suitcase. It would be very much appreciated if it could all be collected as making the area look unpleasant
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cypress Gardens, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Flytipping (not witnessed and no evidence likely)

item.title: Drains not working, 3rd September
item.description:
Drains at Everest road and Old Bath Road junction are not fit for purpose as rain pours down from Leckhampton hill. My driveway/Garage has now flooded 3 times, whilst the neighbor has had water flooding up from toilets and showers.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Everest Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken glass, 3rd September
item.description:
Reported over a week ago. Great danger to wildlife. Still not cleaned up. Please remove it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bath Parade, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sign required re road closure, 3rd September
item.description:
A sign needs to be put here to tell HGV drivers to turn around and use the correct diversion route (due to the closed A40 / Hambrook bridge repairs) and that they must not travel through the village. The village is in chaos and the traffic poses a danger to pedestrians as traffic is using the pavements to get through. Children have returned to the three schools in the village and the volume of traffic is very dangerous
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Woodgate Close, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
